paper_abstract: The Randic index of an organic molecule whose molecular graph is G is the sum of the weights (d(u)d(v))(-1/2) of all edges uv of G, where d(u) and d(v) are the degrees of the vertices u and v in G. In the paper, we give a sharp lower bound on the Randic index of cacti.
paper_title: On the Randic index of cacti
